Title: The Pros, Cons and Oks for the Echo 3rd Gen (HR).
Body: Pros: This is a solid built machine. Very sturdy and no dust cracks, while retaining its simple form. One of the few times I can say you_e getting exactly what every picture on the web is showing. I had the basic black design, but I do appreciate that Amazon is offering more colors rather than there basic set (even if it_ only a few generic colors). The mute option is the most appreciative tool. When you activate it the classic blue glow will fall into the red, giving you the visual display that your privacy is being protected. The sound performs exactly what it_ built for. I found no issue in testing in an open living room. The volume goes to great levels as once again, for a 360-degree smart speaker, Amazon reigns supreme. Testing all ranges of music, I found that that bass to be rich and powerful. My colleague has the previous Echo Plus and she states that there is an improvement in the bass with this Echo. An overall rich sound when a piano came in and a warmer outcome when acoustics came into play (You_l get the bass experience when you hit those hard beats). Like any other model, the Bluetooth connectivity between a third party stereo works flawlessly. I tested this out with some Bose surround sound, and nothing but clear music. You can also pair the Echo if you have smaller / weaker speakers. Both together will pump up the experience. The connectivity is so flawless that buying two of these devices (or use Echo_ previous versions, if you have one) and put them in separate locations doesn_ make this a bad idea. You_e going to get great quality in music without paying an am or a leg for it. I have to appreciate Amazon for not pushing their music platform. They offer the usual Spotify (which I used) but also Apple Music, Deezer, TuneIn, even BBC sounds. You_e getting a lot more features than just a basic smart speaker. Using Google Home for over a year I can say that just saying _lexa felt more natural than saying _k Google. Not to mention having Alexa listen to me every time I said: _lexa (Google Home users will understand this). Like before, smart applications fit like a glove in this system. I only used it for lights and the Echo was spot on. This feature is more common than ever on any smart speaker, and the Echo does what it_ supposed to do. I admire the organization of the app because it_ your remote control on anything you want the Echo to do. Turn off lights, switch music, mute volume, install new features, and so forth. We all carry our phones like carrying our driver licenses when going outside. This day in age I_l always prefer an app than a physical remote. I did some Alexa calls on this and found only clear responses and answers (this will depend on your Wi-Fi). I would give 70% of Alexa sounding more human. Everything is in the cloud so, you don_ need to worry about manual updates. All taken care of. As I mentioned before, everything else is the same in a smart speaker. Ask for the weather, traffic, upcoming appointments, and all other general questions. I didn_ test all of them because_ell is the same technology as last year. The biggest difference in my book is the price. Newer and cheaper.Cons and Oks: No Zigbee controller. This isn_ much of an issue, but if you already have a smart house layout than you_l need to spend some extra time configuring with the Echo. The issue for this is that it puts more work on the Echo than you need. Also, there may be some smart devices that won_ work on the Echo because of this. I know last year's models had some connectivity issues with Philips Hue bulbs. Keep an eye out for which smart devices are compatible with the Echo. I did notice that the app slows down when you put a lot of apps and smart applications in the Echos. I tested a lot of features out that require a decent amount of downloads, but the results did create a delay in the app. I have to assume without Zigbee_ software, if you have a lot of smart applications connected to the Echo, and with the general apps you use, there will be a delay in the long run. The Echo gets loud. Loud enough that you_l get some distortion when you_e around 95% in volume. The effect is shown when a lot of bass is begin made. Please note that 90% and up is booming your entire house. Compare to Google Home, Alexa still isn_ the brightest smart speak in the family. For the basic day to day task it works fine, but those random questions that we tend to have throughout the day Alexa doesn_ deliver. Alexa will usually provide you with a quick one-sentence summary (Unlike Google, it would provide you a short paragraph.). This issue doesn_ happen all the time, but you_l notice it when it does. I_ trying to learn Spanish, so asking smile Spanish questions with Alexa is not reliable. Example I will say _lexa, what does _u칠 est치s haciendo in Spanish mean (What are you doing?)? Alexa will say _hat are you happy. I_e been studying for 6 moths so my speech on that sentence was spot on, but Alexa. Not a reliable study buddy. I had the first version of the Echo and all I can say is I miss the rotation ring. Bring it back Amazon. The design is nothing new. It_ built very solid, but it_ identical to Echo Plus 2. My colleague had the Echo Plus and putting them aside there was no way you can tell the difference (a nice note if you want to steal your friends and replace it with the last version). Even the sound is almost similar to the previous Echo. Both are fantastic, but almost the same.Bottom Line:It_ a great smart speaker system, but almost identical in every way as its previous model. There is nothing wrong with that because Amazon does put in a lot of features into this Echo that makes this right in the top three (Google Home, HomePods, and the Echo Family). It_ accurate, excellent sound, and lower in price than its previous model.Some concerns are the effects in the long run with those who have a decent amount of smart applications, and making sure the compatibility can be performed accurately. Also knowing the limits of what Alexa can and can_ do as the hardware is identical to its previous version. I wouldn_ be surprised if you want to just read Echo_ previous model amazon reviews. Trust me when I say that they_e almost identical in sight and performance.In the end, the reason it doesn_ matter about the flaws is because the price is well worth what you_e getting. It_ a machine that I can see using it every day for the simplest things such as setting up an alarm to enjoying it in small parties. I will say that if you_e planning to use your surround sound stereo connected to this, then this is a must buy. You pay a heavy price for a HomePod, enjoy a generic performance for a Google Home, and are presented with an overall user-friendly experience with the Echo 3. Cheaper than its predecessor and the worth every penny.Overall: A tiny upgrade from its previous model, but still an excellent experience in sound for all.Hope I was a help to you.Love,Honest Reviewer

Title: Overall really nice product with good sound quality.
Body: I mainly use this Alexa as a speaker for my music. The sound quality on this Alexa is better than on the previous Alexa in my opinion. It's super easy to set up and use. I often change the location of my Alexa as well because as I said I mainly use it as a speaker.  It does really well if you need to unplug it and and plug it in in another location (as in it'll connect to the wifi on it's own and you can use it as you normally would without any hassle). I got the charcoal color and it's very nice visually. The Alexa app is also very convenient to use with it. You can personalize the sound of the bass and other mixes too. Overall, I say it's a really nice product. The packaging was super nice and felt high quality as well. No problems with shipping too.

Title: Amazon Echo Does It Again!
Body: I suppose most people are wondering the obvious? Does it have any new features? Does it go well with your decor? Can you order a pizza and in fact, have Alexa pay for it? OK, that one I haven't tried yet... but I will tell you that it is an upgrade, looks sleeker than older versions, and the sound packs a  punch!Some services like apple music are atrocious! The service doesn't stay connected, and it's hardly useable. I venture to guess that this issue is fixable but this far is a letdown.If you're looking for a smart assistant that is extremely useful and always works... look no further! You won't regret it!

Title: Bittersweet Upgrade
Body: I purchased my first Alexa Echo 1st Gen two years ago and I fell in love right away! It was bittersweet for me to replace it with the newer 3rd Gen but they had an amazing trade-in offer so I had to take advantage of it. First thing to note this Echo is much shorter than Gen 1 but a little wider which I prefer because it looks and fits better on my kitchen island. The new blue color is amazing if you_e considering getting it! Setting up the new Echo was the easiest most seamless process! I literally took it out of the box, plugged it in and in under a minute it set itself up and was ready to use! I didn_ have to do anything, it was already programmed with my smart lights and my WiFi, couldn_ ask for an easier setup. I love my Echo and use it every day and if you_e considering getting one, I say go for it! If I had to critique or complain about anything the only thing I could say is the wall adapter is really large since it_ still a square block like Gen 1.  This is more of a personal opinion but Gen 1 had a rotating top to turn the volume up and down (which I loved) where as Gen 3 has volume up and down buttons. Functionally they both work I just though the rotating volume top was more fun and unique, but I_l live on just fine with the buttons.

Title: Wake me when we get there
Body: I bought an Echo and an Echo Dot. What a waste of money. They're basic; real basic. My fault for not truly understanding what I was buying. It can answer some simple questions with simple answers and do a few smart home things and has "skills" but that's about it. Isn't that enough? No, it isn't. I guess I thought I was getting something smart, something I could engage with, seek intelligent replies from, something connected to the world wide web of knowledge. Guess I was wrong. I got a stupid little automated squawk box; a borderline parrot. Guess I got bought. For all our great advances in technology, we're clearly still in our technological infancy. Get back to me when I can say "Computer, describe to me quantum physics in layman's terms. Explain to me the theory of relativity. What exactly is gravity; are there gravity particles? What is the meaning of life?" The answer to the latter better be: 42. Another big gripe is that it's constantly trying to sell me something -running through a whole dales pitch -instead of just doing or playing what I asked, or it tells me what it's about to do even though I just asked it exactly that. Now I know why it's called, Echo. I'll be getting rid of it soon. Anybody wanna buy a stupid, smart device?

Title: Well worth the investment
Body: This is by far, the best Echo / system we have owned from Amazon.We purchased 2 of the generation 3 Echos and an Amazon sub as a package (saved $80 + an additional $60 for taking the Amazon store card) to replace the Bose speaker / Echo Dot we had.We now have room filling sound as good as the Bose combo without having to physically turn on the speaker every time we wanted music.Even without the sub, the sound is robust and rich from each of the linked speakers.  The addition of the powered Echo sub fills in the lows to make it an immersive experience.Setup was fairly easy.  My only complaint was that I had trouble renaming the 2nd Echo itself.  Amazon keeps calling it another wacky name.  Overall, it took less than 5 minutes to link all 3 speakers together and be listening.Would I purchase again?  You can count on it.

Title: Upgraded from Echo (1st Gen)
Body: The sound on the Echo 3rd Gen is amazing!  We upgraded from the 1st Gen and you can clearly hear a deeper base and sound that fills the room.  We liked the different colors and twilight blue didn't disappoint.  The speaker is shorter and wider than the 1st Gen but that is a welcome change.  From a functionality standpoint, I don't see any difference from earlier gen echo devices as they can all answer questions, set timers, update lists, play music or trivia and turn on and off smart devices if you already had a hub such as Philips or Smart Things.  The 3rd Gen does not have its own hub but that was fine for us.  Overall we love the 3rd Gen Echo and highly recommend if you are looking to upgrade from previous gen or if you're in the market as a fist time Alexa Echo purchaser.

Overall still a great product.

Title: Better than Sonos for way less money? In many cases yes!

You can control the Echo via voice, Alexa app, or through the Amazon Music app. All of these are leaps better than the buggy Sonos app. The sound quality is fantastic and the value for your money is higher than any competitor. I do believe I will be purchasing Amazon Echos from here on out.

Title: Better Sound
Body: This is a big upgrade in sound over the Echo dot.  While we use it often in our kitchen, know that it is not high end quality sound - what do you expect from one small speaker.  It is plenty good enough for an enjoyable listening experience, especially for background music while working/cooking.  In comparison, the Echo dot sound was just too poor quality to enjoy without hooking up an auxiliary speaker and so we only used it occasionally.  I was surprised that this new unit defaults to Amazon Music rather than Prime music and so we started getting commercials mixed in to our music stream.  It takes time to get the commands right to connect to Prime music without commercials - not an issue we had with the Echo dot that this unit replaced.

Title: Gen 3 improvement incremental
Body: This speaker, after the Gen 2 echo, didn't blow my socks off.  It sounds great, but then my gen 2 sounded very good also.  I also have a pair of gen 2's grouped as a stereo pair, grouped also with an Echo Sub.  I wouldn't even consider replacing those Gen 2's with Gen 3's.  With the Sub doing a bunch of the system's work, the system sounds great to me already.  So if you're buying new, get the Gen 3 for sure (not a used or refurbed set of Gen 2s)  If you have Gen 2s, you probably should keep them.  Unless you are a toy boy like me!

I listen to pop and rock a great deal, nature sounds for sleeping, and right now some opera arias. I am happy with all of them.The new look is wonderful. I like that it is shorter and wider. More stable on a shelf or table.I do a great deal of house sitting and take many of my own things with me. This is getting packed in that travel bag!The only negative I find is that the fabric cover somewhat covers the light ring on top, and the light seems less bright.Now how do I convince my husband that I need another at home with one in my bedroom and three Dots around the house?

Title: Brief mode doesn't work and it sometimes responds to words that aren't Alexa
Body: As Amazon added new features, they gradually got to the point where they decided to make the Echo You're folksy companion rather than a machine for automation and hands-free work. I turned on brief mode because I don't want a 5-minute conversation when I'm just trying to check the weather or turn on the lights. It didn't work. I still get it to tell me to have a nice day instead of the basic tone it's supposed to play, and sometimes it tries to tell me about new features I don't need when I just want it to read the weather.Sometimes I find it listening after picking up on a word like Election.  This is especially annoying when I'm having a conversation and it chimes in about how it came help me with that.I have both Google and Amazon devices, but I'll be replacing the Amazon ones this year because of the broken features.Update: An Amazon representative contacted me and we spoke about the issues I've experienced. He mentioned that one of them could be resolved by a setting in the app, so it should no longer try to tell me about new features.  I'm actually only updating my review to say that a TV show said "sure," and the Echo just responded to the TV to tell it about Sure brand deodorant. I've unplugged the Echo for now.  We call this a "time out."

Title: Worst alexa device I have bought
Body: I already have four Alexas; one previous generation and three dots scattered all over my house. The 2nd generation dots are really nice, and so I thought I'd go with the better sound and latest upgrade for Alexa. The setup was absolutely a dream, and she was up and running in no time. Really liked the better sound, too. But then all of a sudden we began to notice she was just getting too chatty, always asking us if we wanted to do this thing or that thing and THEN...she began asking us if we wanted to be referred to other things to buy! REALLY? I finally found a place in the Alexa app to make her less chatty, but then we noticed that there was a random "Bloop", or "Bloop-bloop." sound just out of the blue until it was driving us nuts. Not all that often, but way more often than we could stand. Then, the final straw. I have my four alexa devices scattered throughout my house and in a group, so I can just tell Alexa to play some music on all the devices and I'll have music throughout the house. Well, she suddenly just took it upon herself to drop right out of the group! Suddenly, when I told her to play music throughout the house, she would do so, but only on the Alexas that weren't in the main room. THAT'S IT!  I packaged her up and sent her back and wrote this review. I really only want her to answer the questions I ask and not embellish and give me a life history or ask me if I want to go other places. I'm glad I still have my old Alexa. I hooked her back up again and while she may not sound quite as good, she's a lot easier to live with, AND she works, too.

Title: Awesome ! I recommend this over the G word.

I lost connection over and over with the G word and so far after more than a month, I have never lost connection with Miss Alexa so I am very happy and being a prime member And being able to pay for it monthly you just can_ beat that so thank you Amazon you will have a prime member as long as I_ around.The bass quality is awesome....the sound quality, and if you don_ know the difference i_ sorry, is awesome and me being an audiophile I don_ use The word awesome lightly.You can_ go wrong with Miss Alexa.

Title: Great sound and neat features. But...
Body: I really like the echo 3rd. Gen. I_e never really owned a smart speaker before.  I mainly use mine for music now and then but I do have a big gripe about it. Not so much the device but the amazon music service really sucks imo for a big reason. Now originally I just had this echo and signed up for amazon music unlimited, and for a while it was fantastic ! A few months later I got my hands on a new amazon tap speaker thinking it would be really great to have a speaker play at each side of my room for a more stereo sound. I synced up my new tap to my account , made a speaker group for both devices , requested a song to play and was greeted with _orry to play this song on this group of speakers you need to upgrade your music plan Wait what?! In order for me to use more than one speaker in my one room I need to pay more money? I looked up more info and sure enough yah , you need to pay more money to have the SAME song play one MORE THAN ONE device. Kinda bull shyt  if you ask me. Well just keep that in mind if you plan on buying more than one for expanded sound. That said , some songs play on both with no problem and other times it says I need to pay for an up grade. Buyer beware.

Title: Good product and amazing customer service
Body: Had a difficult time setting up 4 speakers together. I did everything right just had a glitch I guess. After a little effort Amazon reached out and took care of the problem. Their customer service lady Kristina was amazing. She was the second person I talked to.. The first wasn't so helpful.The problem is fixed and Kristina really made me feel at ease and reassured me she'd fix the problem at all costs, the entire time. It says a lot about Amazon. I couldn't have talked to a better person to help solve the problem. Good job Amazon! Give her a promotion!The product is great too. Once connected it works flawlessly. Hopefully you don't run into the same problem I did, but if you do rest assured Amazon will do whatever it takes to solve it.Where else can you get that? Not many places. Thanks Kristina and thanks Amazon!

Title: No ragerts with newest Echo
Body: Decided to replace the Google Home that came free with my phone purchase a few years back since it was being unresponsive lately and the Echo Dot I got for Christmas 2 years ago has been fantastic. The setup was easy but the Alexa app wouldn't connect to the Echo Wi-Fi on the first 2 attempts. I had to reopen the app and try again.The sound quality is amazing, amd fills the room well. Decent bass for a speaker of this size and price. Alexa is a little slow to respond, but typically in less than 1 second she'll answer you. She also has trouble streaming Pandora but it wasn't a show stopper and hopefully will work after a reboot.There's an interesting typo I noticed on my Echo box. "She makes life easier by letting YOU voice control your world." Hopefully I didn't receive a knock off from Amazon, but I would think a product like this gets proofread.

Title: worthy upgrade from 1st gen
Body: having had the 1st gen since the first invite, decided to make the upgrade when the 3rd gen went on sale.  traded in the 1st gen and ended up paying about $20 for the 3rd gen.3rd gen is lighter by about 10oz but significantly wider and shorter (36oz 1st gen / 26 oz 3rd gen) than the 1st gen.  hooked it up and music seems to have better bass.  made some adjustments in the eq in alexa app and it does sound clearer compared to the 1st gen.  no issues with sound quality.the most significant upgrade imo is the improvement in mic.  the 3rd gen is much more sensitive to the wake word even while blasting music.  1st gen would sometimes miss the wake word even during silence and good luck trying to wake it while blasting music.  3rd gen has no issues waking even when blasting music.  the only thing it doesn't have is the ring to adjust the volume and i thought i would miss that but not at all.  it has the buttons now but rarely use it anyway since the mic sensitivity is now so much improved.  all in all a no brainer especially after sale price and trade in.

Title: Multilingual mode doesnt work
Body: I am overall satisfied with my Echo and recently bought a new on for my parents who speak spanish mainly.  Multilingual mode which is mentioned in below user guide for alexsa is not working properly.whether i select English/Espanol or Espanol/English, alex only understands english commands.  she wont recognize my spanish commands.is Espanol only mode, she does recognize both spanish and english commands, but all of her responses are in spanish.there is no way to get her to respond in english to an english command, and spanish to a spanish command which is clearly stated on the amazon website (link below)i tried calling for support twice, and twice the rep wasnt aware of this feature, and once i showed them the website with the feature clearly described, they somehow magically got disconnected and i lost my support.for the bad customer support experience, i am leaving only 3 stars.https://www.amazon.com/b/ref=aeg_lp_sc_d/ref=s9_acss_bw_cg_aeglp_6a1_w?node=17978647011&pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf_rd_s=merchandised-search-4&pf_rd_r=TB3Q8ZRP1D3WSCXKAJGD&pf_rd_t=101&pf_rd_p=854092b7-c46b-4f6c-ba7e-7b6e17552e7c&pf_rd_i=17934671011

Title: Very happy with it!
Body: I am very disappointed in this. I have been using the Echo Dot for a month and thought I would come up with the perfect anniversary gift for our 30th. The Echo is muffled and is absolutely not worth the 70 dollar price difference. On top of that it goes on sale $40 less than what I paid to add insult to injury. Because it was over 7 days I could not get a price adjustment. Should have had our anniversary a couple weeks sooner!People at work are waiting for my feedback to see if they should go with one of these and I can say with full confidence they need to pass on this one.Update:20 minutes after I posted this review my phone rang and it was a wonderful person from Amazon by the name of Kristina. She apologized for my experience and showed me how to adjust the bass, treble and midrange to give me the sound the device was meant to put out. She also arranged for me to return the Echo and buy another one to get the sale price. This is the gold standard of customer service that other businesses should strive for.  Thank you for caring!

Title: Don't listen to the experts knock a $79 speaker!
Body: I don't want to hear from audiophiles talk about how this doesn't have the range or response of blah blah blah.  Please don't listen to those people either simply because if they were so expert, their ears SO sensitive to precise megahertz and bass/treble/midrange ratios...why are they wasting time on a $79 speaker??The fact is, for 99.9% of us, us who have listened to and loved music our whole lives, these things are AMAZING.  Not only the sound quality which is as good or better than anything out there for twice the price, but for the convenience of being able to call up any song by speaking your request.How does this compare to Bose or Sonos?  Who cares, both of those are more expensive, can't be easier to setup (especially Sonos - which started out with great app function but went completely off the rails) and can't be easier to use.  You can't regret buying these things, and couples with the subwoofer, you'll be in da club...

Title: Get the Echo 3rd Gen, Skip the 3rd Gen Dot.
Body: I have had the echo dot 2nd gen, 3rd gen, and now the regular echo 3rd gen. From what I understand the echo 3rd generation is the same speaker as the echo plus 2nd generation except it doesn't have Zagbee integration (whatever that is). Sound wise echo is better than the dot, by a fair margin. Is it 1000 dollar studio monitor speakers good? No. Is it worth 60-100 bucks? Absolutely. They sound just as good as any normal pc speakers you would get from Logitech or Harman.If you want to know if the dot or this is worth getting just get this. The dot has good sound quality but only 4 microphones ontop so it's DEAF. It will hear you when it feels like it, this one has like 12 microphones so it will hear you. Get the echo skip the dot.

Title: Potential, but not quite there
Body: Speaker sounds great when it works.  There was one instance (in the 3 days it_ been operational) when the highs sounded distorted during music playback, like the speaker was blown.  When testing with Alexa, her voice had an apparent _isp when responding to prompts.  A quick unplug and replug seemed to take care of the problem; but it_ unknown when the issue will occurrence again.  Returning and reordering while the device is still on sale.  Giving one as a gift and worried about the functionality for recipients that are not as technically inclined.  Spoke with tech support and they asked about the wifi connection, saying it could have been interrupted.  I had a 2nd gen dot in the same location with no issues prior.  Router and connectivity is not the problem.  After more questioning and a brief hold, the rep responded there is no known problem with the 3rd gen echo.  Hopefully Amazon will addresses this issues as it appears this is not an isolated instance (do a quick google search).  Until then, I cannot recommend to others.

I still can't figour out a way to ask alaxa to play the music in my phone.One advise to any new Echo users: it's very helpful & useful to google any question (how to... echo...) if you are unsure about how to make echo work.

Title: It's an Echo...but crackles when woken...
Body: We're an Alexa household, with an Echo speaker in almost every room, not to mention our smart plugs, bulbs, and such. So we're in it for the long haul. We went to upgrade our final Echo Dot to a full-fledged Echo. This was our first 3rd Gen (our 2nd Gen Echos are wonderful, so we figured, the 3rd Gen must be even better). The sound quality and ease of setup was second-to-none (comparable to 2nd Gen - no marked improvement - probably given that the 2nd Gen is about perfect). HOWEVER, we stream a lot of music in our home. And Echo usually does a flawless job at it, even syncing across devices. However, one small (arguably nitpicky) problem with this 3rd Gen unit. When you wake this unit while music is playing, it pauses the music as expected to listen to your command; however, after pausing it also sounds a momentary crackle/pop (and by momentary, a teeny-tiny fraction of a second). You start talking to it and it pops. Just enough, however, to drive you mad. And frankly, it's just not acceptable. Not when our other units work perfectly.I contact tech support, and they said that they were able to replicate it, and that it was "completely normal." Well, I'm a reasonable person, but this just kind of cheapens the experience, and frankly I'm not convinced it is normal behavior (by the way, we restarted it/reset it/upgraded it/basically everything to try and rectify). And maybe this wouldn't be an issue for most (the speaker is wonderful otherwise), but we use our Echos heavily, often interrupting the music to turn on lights, for example, and I just don't want to hear it pop and crackle when I'm talking to it.

Title: Audio lacking for my taste
Body: I would not pay $100 for this.  $60 or less is about right.  The sound right out of the box is pretty bland but I did locate some equalizer settings in the Alexa app that made it better. Unfortunately, that's just not enough. I like it loud and when you approach the 3/4 mark on volume the bass drops out and you are left with hollow muffled sound.  Although not up to my rock out level, I found it to be fairly loud considering its footprint. Speaking to Alexa at a pretty decent volume actually worked....No more screaming at the dot from the shower to SKIP!  I suppose I expected more from all of the glowing reviews but considering the build and size of the speaker I should have suspected the performance capability.  This doesn't work for my audio tastes so this will be returned. I hope the Echo Studio performs better.

Every week I would have to down load different songs and then load them to the mp3 player now I just have to ask Alexa. It's only been a few days but I am Loving it. Title: Quality Smart Speakers
Body: The sound on this thing surprised me for its size. I keep the volume between 5-7 out of 10 max, and that's loud and clear enough to fill my medium-sized living roon. Alexa works great, and no complaints there. It would've been nice if it had an internal rechargeable battery, but also makes sense to keep it in your house plugged in the whole time.

Title: Fantastic!
Body: This is my first Alexa speaker, but i've been streaming music for years though various moderately high-end computer speakers and a large selection of bluetooth speakers - everything from cheapies to a 50 watt guitar amp with bluetooth.I'm not an audiophile, but I do like my music to sound good - which, to me, means balanced, not bass-heavy, with good clarity and a high end that doesn't become strident at higher volumes.I bought three of these to have at different locations around the house.  Setup was super simple, d/l the app and sign in to your Amazon account and you're up and running.  No issues at all.Here's what I love so far:  Alexa is super easy to get along with...Alexa, with whom I get along easily...?...has been a treat.  I've been an Amazon music user for a few years now.  I like the selection but using the app on a phone or tablet is a frustrating experience, and it can also be super clunky and slow on a PC, as well.With this speaker I can ask Alexa to play a song, album or playlist and it's playing within moments.  Awesome!  Also, Alexa gave me a detailed, accurate weather forecast this morning.  Nice!  I haven't explored all the features, but I primarily want these for music.And as far as that goes, the sound quality is better than I expected, and I've got no complaints.  I have one speaker on top of my fridge in the kitchen and the sound is just amazing.  Balanced and clear with more than enough bass.  I listened to some jazz, some alt-country, some reggae and some ambient music.  They all sounded great - as good as I could hope for.And Alexa heard me from the next room without a problem.These speakers are well worth their price, and at the Black Friday price they're an incredible value.  These speakers have  removed my Amazon Music frustration (or a large chunk of them, anyway) and allowed me much better access to what I'm paying for.

I am glad I took a chance on the echo 3rd gen. I actually ordered two additional without hearing this. I just received it today and my hard to please self is very pleased with the sound! I see reviews that sonos is better, HomePod is better, but really? How can you compare echo to devices that are multiple times the cost. I am hard to please with my devices, and am an Apple guy. However I_e had dots for a couple years and like Alexa. I will keep Apple for mobile devices. For easy to place speakers the house I will use Echo s,art speakers. After re-reading this review, I think I will order a fourth one now since it is still priced so well. Amazon, give a sale price on the sub and I will gladly purchase.

Title: Don't waste your time.
Body: We got this and was very excited to use it.  However it would not connect.  We tried every way possible.  We tried it thru the app on the phone, thru an amazon tablet, thru a Microsoft surface.  Nothing would work.  We called support.  They needed access to our computer, so I allowed it.  They did all kinds of stuff but not once did they try to connect the device.  I could see everything they were doing.  They had us putting in passwords to the connection etc.. They said our network was at risk etc.  then they tried to sell us stuff. This is the number that was given when it said to call support immediately by the way.  So after we got off the phone with support, we run a scan and all of the sudden our network is not safe....go figure.  My husband is very tech savy and he was quite sure they did something especially since they tried us to buy software to "fix our network" and never once tried to connect to the device.  So we had to fix that and then do a factory reset on all of our devices.  I even looked online and tried other option such as rebooting the modem, the router, the echo.  ABSOLUTELY NOTHING WORKED.  The phone we tried to use is a Samsung S10 PLus.I DO NOT RECOMMED THIS PRODUCT!

Title: Sounds Great
Body: I bought a pair of the Echo 3rd Gen in blue (a great color, by the way) along with an Echo Sub as a gift to myself. I once had a nice, full stereo turntable system, but got rid of it after too many moves. I have several Echo Dots, but missed a fuller stereo sound. This system was easy to set up, fits unobtrusively into my family room (yes, even in blue), and sounds amazing for its size and cost. I tested it with "In-A-Gadda-Da-Vida" and it put a smile on my ears.

Title: Light years better with the sound!
Body: I bought one of the original Echos mostly for fun.  It has been a great product, but The sound for music was no better than OK. This new version is a huge improvement in terms of sound.  True audiophiles need to look elsewhere.  However, the average listener will find the sound highly rewarding especially when this Echo is available on sale.  At $60, I highly recommend it.  At $100, you might want to save up for the Echo Studio costing $200.

Title: Very Insensitive microphones, HOWEVER......
Body: I bought this to replace an Echo Dot 3 in my family room. My intention was to get improved audio quality for music.The audio is somewhat better than the Dot3 that it replaced. However, this unit  often fails to hear, or comprehend, my voice commands, and those of my wife, a problem which the Dot 3 that it replaced in precisely the same location never displayed.In fact, the Dot 3 which I moved to an adjacent room often picks up my voice commands when I am speaking to the Echo in the family room, and the Dot 3 is about 3 times the distance away with no direct line-of-sight to the family room.HOWEVER....I was asked to return this item to Amazon, sending it to their Engineering lab. in Sunnyvale, which I did. A couple of days later the replacement unit arrived, and once it was up and running the difference was immediately obvious.The replacement unit will respond to a quietly voiced command from across the room, and misunderstood commands are very, very few.Thanks, Amazon! Great customer service and a good outcome.Chris PScottsdale, AZ

Title: Easy to install and use, LOUD, and conveniently flexible
Body: I got my first Echo as a gift from my brother, and I was extremely impressed with it. As a legally blind person, I can't use my laptop anymore, so the first Echo was a godsend. It helps me to find information, listen to podcasts, music and books, and play games and educate my s of in different ways, and easily order items I might need.The first device died after 5 years of use, and after some collaborations, I was able to gather enough gift cards for a replacement. I picked up the Echo 3rd gen, and I'm very happy. It's loud enough to drown out the neighbor's loud music and my roommates' Fox News; it's clear enough that I can hear my podcasts without straining, and it's just as easy to use as the original.Definitely worth the price. 10/10.

Title: Love it! The audio quality is great
Body: I have the 1st gen Echo at home, and I use it as a voice assistant as well as a music speaker to stream my playlist on Spotify. I didn't feel like the audio quality of gen 1 Echo is bad at all until I got this 3rd gen Echo. The audio quality improved a lot. Since I have another 5 Echo Dots (3rd gen) at home, I can now enjoy the whole home audio feature by grouping them up. Nice job, Amazon

Title: Incredibly disappointed with Alex and Fire TV integration. False Advertising
Body: Incredibly disappointed. This was one of EIGHT Fire TV and/or Echo devices that I purchased on Black Friday, hoping to switch from Roku TV and have a seamless smarthome experience. Oh boy, was I wrong.Whether I rename the the Fire TV devices or use their original names, the echo devices CANNOT control or recognize the tv devices, even after properly pairing them under the TV & Video setting in the Alexa app. I've tried to unpair, repair, restart, unregister, reregister, you name it. I've wasted days.  Generally, Alexa responds with 'I cannot find a device named ...' I consider myself very technically savy and I'm positive this is not something that I'm doing wrong. I should've read more into this before buying. TONS of people all over the internet are having this problem. It's infuriating. Plain and simple, until problems like this are fixed, Amazon is blaintantly false advertising the way that their devices work.Other cons to note:-Multiple video apps stutter and sometimes even randomly pause without ever resuming unless you physically resume them.-Alexa drastically lowers the volume of the TV when you are voicing a command. This in-and-of-itself is not a huge problem. However, it becomes a problem often when after the command is complete, Alexa does not resume the original volume of the content. When this has happened, I've had to ask Alexa to turn the volume back up to the specific number it was at.-I have two third generation echos paired as a stereo system for the TV. Often, even though I have my fire TV set as the preferred device, only the echos hear my voice, and once again, because they cannot control the TV, they say that they cannot recognize the device and then I just have to pick up the controller anyway.-The Fire TV will often think that it hears an 'Alexa' when absolutely no where near that word has been stated. Because the volume lowers drastically when Alexa is listening, it creates an obnoxious volume dip in content to listen for nothing when this happens.-You cannot set a sleep timerHonestly I could go on and on about the cons and about just how unhappy I am about these products. There are even more problems than what I listed here, but I'm not wasting too much breath, as after doing days and days of research on these topics, I've seen that Amazon has absolutely no answers to these problems, even after thousands of people have reported the same problems over and over. Unless there is some revalatory software updated coming, I'll be returning hundreds of dollars of equipment.

Title: First impressions compared to the Echo Dot 3rd gen
Body: We only owned a single 2nd gen dot and 2 3rd gen dots. I saw the echo 3rd gen was new and on sale during Black Friday weekend for $60, so I grabbed one. We wanted another echo dot but after reading and watching reviews I decided to spend a bit more and go with a full blown echo.The echo dot 3rd gens are amazing. They really are. For $22 on sale they are especially a no brainer. The sound quality is night and day compared to the 1st and 2nd gen dot. Like twice as good regarding sound quality and fullness and how loud it can get. Alarms will actually wake you.After watching some reviews of the new big echo here, I was sold. Now and then we use the living room echo for some music while we clean or to just goof off and dance like idiots lol. While the dot did good, why not go fuller and louder with the big echo?Well, it_ still an amazing unit. Does all the dot does, of course. However, while the sound is fuller and louder, it_ not going to blow you away. I guess maybe I overhyped it based on the reviews I saw and their reactions, but I was a bit bummed.Yes, absolutely it_ louder...my totally unscientific measurement would be it_ like....15-20% louder and fuller sounding (deep, more bass, higher highs etc). I_ not sure what I was expecting. Maybe I_ be happier regarding sound with the _tudio version? I don_ know. I don_ regret the purchase, though. The extra volume is welcome and it definitely does sound better with music. Happy but I believe I overhyped. If I had the money, I_ def replace the dots with the full echos. Only pluses and no negatives other than being less amazing as I had made it in my own head.

Title: Comparing to 2nd Gen Echo
Body: Sound Quality is an improvement to the 2nd gen echo. After about 2 weeks of moderate usage at 60-70% volume the speaker has sounded better than it did day one, as most speakers need time to break-in.Comparing it to the 2nd gen echo you can definitely hear a difference. There is a bit more low end compared to the 2nd however, I find the mid range to be more refined on the 2nd gen as the 3rd gen has more low end and high end sound.To get this straight. This speaker isn_ meant to provide room filling rich sound as it is only a single firing 3 inch woofer and a tweeter enclosed in a compact plastic housing. If your looking at rich sounding sound docks, bose soundtouch 20 or 30 would fulfill that much better and even though those are more room filling as well, audiophiles will still find it much suited to having an actual speaker and amp setup. I myself am considered an audio snob and I love playing around with audio equipment.I_ not going to compare the echo to a proper 7.2.2 channel setup but compare it to speakers in its class. Being that this is an Amazon Alexa Device it is a very useful tool in addition to your smartphone. I currently have 6 echos throughout the house and they do what they are supposed to do and that is having voice commands for lights and even notifications for your ring system as well as other smart devices you link to your Alexa account. Having the ability to connect Bluetooth to your phone is great as well if your not looking for a portable battery powered Bluetooth speaker.My main reason for purchasing this echo is the new speaker which attracted me to purchasing this and I mainly use it only in the kitchen as having background music and being able to control lights and sound while working on other things. Sound is great for the kitchen and it is plenty loud enough with very balanced sound and I find the bass to be good for it_ size. I would like to put my bose soundtouch in the kitchen but it takes up too much room and I can just place this in a corner and it_ compact enough that you won_ have to worry about knocking it over. However I have setup my echo dot onto a sound dock and linked the multi room audio so I can have music playing through Apple Music in all rooms through the echos which I think is what sets this speaker apart from let_ say the much more expensive Sonos or Bose Soundlinks. Only downside I wish I could do is have Bluetooth work with multi audio instead of having to play playlists or through other streaming services on the echo.

Title: Small but mighty!
Body: I really was hesitant to buy this as it was my first Echo product. I have plans to install a smart thermostat for the house soon. This came with a monthly installment option so I took the chance. At half volume this little thing has amazing sound and although you won't get club bumping base you will get enough to give the song a great sound. You can listen to local radio stations, audio books and other services like Pandora, Apple Music, SiriusXM, Spotify etc so you aren't just limited to Amazon Music.  Alexa hears me well. I can talk like I normally would and she responds. Even  my Siri on my phone has to be yelled at often. The extras like reminders or countdowns to a specific date is great. I set up what orders are due next and she reminds me. I found the trivia of the day fun and interesting. I am actually going back to get another for my bedroom as this one will be in my office and probably move to different areas as needed when guests come over.

Title: Like it except for the disconnects
Body: I like it, it sounds surprisingly good for such a small speaker.  Unfortunately it randomly shuts off.  To restart, it needs to be unplugged and then plugged in. This happens every 2 hours or so.  I wanted to exchange to hopefully get a unit that stayed connected but tech support had other ideas.  They wanted me to change the name and password of my WIFI network.  I explained that my WIFI stays connected without interruption to a TV, printer, 2 iPhones and 2 computers.  There is no chance that I will make changes to a properly functioning WIFI network, requiring me to update the network name and password on all my devices.  If tech support was accurate then the product design needs to be improved, a device should not require altering a perfectly functioning WIFI network.

Title: Utter disbelief!
Body: I'm in complete shock that Amazon has failed to provide a platform in the Amazon Alexa app to choose specific days for morning alarms. Something so trivial and simple as that has not been designed yet. I just got off the phone. They're going to forward it to somebody higher. Can you believe this? You can choose X days of the week with reminders but not with daily alarms. So this means that my son who works Monday through Saturday and is only off on Sunday has to be woken up on Sunday morning in order to be woken up Monday through Saturday or unplug the device on Saturday night. Can you believe that? I'm sorry but my mind is absolutely blown that these people who want to be leaders of every technical thing in the world and the shopping leaders of the world have dropped the ball so ridiculously in this department. Like I said, still in utter shock and I have five of these devices in my house. I have dedicated over two hours of my day to this matter and I feel like putting all five devices in the drive and driving over them repeatedly with my car. And I mean repeatedly. Wherever mr. Bezos is... You dropped the ball

Title: Alexa is fantastic, sound less so.
Body: Bought one of these for the kitchen. It replaces a Memorex Party Cube which had thoroughly degraded over a decade.The functionality of Alexa is discussed at length everywhere and is amazing. My only issue with this device is the sound quality. I think it's inherent to the design and I did anticipate this. First of all, the bass is astounding. I didn't know something this size could create that kind of bass. I'm afraid treble is another story. In order to create the 360 degree sound, the tweeter (as you can see in the product description) is pointed upward inside the device. It fires internally. The midrange radiates quite well out of the unit as reflected sound. However, the high frequencies (say, above 14khz) do not fare so well. So overall the treble slopes off quite a bit. The old Party Cube, like the Sonos One, has outward firing tweeters, so you are not relying on sound reflection for what you hear - you get the whole spectrum straight from the source, like conventional speakers. So you miss a bit of the magic of vocals, or drum high hats, atmospheric sounds and the like. Out of the box the overall tone is weighed quite a bit to mid bass. Alexa has some basic tone control (Bass, Midrange, Treble) which can help just a bit.Overall though, the Pros outweigh the cons on this device and I'm happy to have it!

Title: Decreasing quality in products from Amazon
Body: Honestly, I thought I got better sound performance from my Gen1 echo than this one. My old one broke and the program to trade in plus black Friday made this a good deal so hard to complain too much.Overall I would NOT call this a premium product. It's passable and the interface with other smart home products is good but it sort of feels like Amazon is cheaping out on the product now that consumer adoption is near saturation. Basically a bait and switch from Amazon; initial model is high quality to attract customers and once you have them, bring out a cheaper model.Pros- easy to setup, even for those who aren't tech savvy- interfaces with other smart products well- good deal on sale- great gift if someone doesn't haveMeh- app is not as controllable as I would like- voice recognition is ok. Basic commands are flawless but anything more is beyond its capabilitiesCons- speaker sound quality- asking questions gives irrelevant responses- media player in app kinda sucks to control. For example, switching from one speaker to multiple room is a little challenging in app once the music is playingI felt the same way about the echo auto. Not well engineered, just forced a product out and people are left disappointed with the results. Won't be purchasing again once this one breaks.

Title: I use it for music mostly
Body: I love this. I use it mostly for music, alarms and ordering from Amazon. So many more possibilities but I use the apps for my security cams. I have an iPad so I see no need for the show me feature. But if you have a lousy,  slow, ring app, I think that would be the hot shot.  I tore the ring doorbell out with my bare hands I was so pissed. By the time you open the app everything that was going to happen has already happened whoever was at the door is already gone. By the time the app opens, everything that was going to happen has already happened. So the show me feature has got to be quicker than the ring app and would be a nice addition to alexa. Then I_e connected _he dots.. I wondered why they call them dots, now it all makes sense. I use the dots for stereo sound in my home. They all work the same as Echo. You don_ need Echo to have the dots either. Dots are smaller so the speaker is smaller, that_ all. Great for smaller rooms and still have a good quality speaker. Better privacy controls on these. You can turn off the speaker manually and if you want delete everything you said that day you can do that too. Ask Alexa to do it for you. Decent app. Play with the settings. Good deal all around.

Title: Much more sensitive to hearing your voice...better bass
Body: The sensitive microphones pick up your voice much better than the echo dot. Alexa can hear your commands even if playing loud music.  For its size, this has room filling sound with a nice balance of lows and highs.  Excellent for music playback. Highly recommend this device.

Title: Sounds great (when it works)

Title: Almost there
Body: The echo is an impressive speaker. Sound is incredible for such a tiny speaker at that price. I would give 6 stars for that.However there are so many things making the Alexa echo annoying, that should be fixed:- the voice recognition is awful when you are used to Google- Most of the time say something, Alexa will answer "I don't know". It is faster to use the thermostat app to set the AC than to talk to Alexa- Playing music from the app is a nightmare (it only works through the desktop alexa website) and you need a paid service to play the music you want- The stereo sound does not work in bluetooth- There should be more Alexa integration in IFTT You cannot control Alexa as a Then clause

Title: Significant Upgrade over Generation 1
Body: Bought this to replace a public beta-era Generation 1 unit. The first gen unit had slowed down a bit, and was beginning to struggle with running our smart home components, missing light bulbs and other things in the Hue network.This thing is FAST compared to earlier models. What would take 5-10 seconds of processing for the gen-1 takes only a second or two for this model. The sound quality remains excellent for music playback, and while the model is "fatter" it is noticeably shorter, making it slightly more subtle for where I have mine (on a table next to a wall).If you're looking to get your first Echo or upgrade from an older model I definitely recommend making the change.

Title: Disappointed in packaging
Body: I am sure I will like the product but cannot believe how this was shipped. It was just put into a packing envelope.  This item is a little more substantial and comes in its own box so in turn it should have come in a bigger shipping box not a packing envelope.  There was a about 4000 pounds of tape and the box for the item was all crushed.  Hope it is not damaged but will not find out until xmas morning.  1 star for packing probably 5 star for product.

Title: Started failing after about a month, and I didn't have time to call support.
Body: I got this for my Dad, who is blind and in a nursing home, to replace a refurb Echo Dot.  I did this when I visited him, 1500 miles away.  It worked flawlessly, the sound and bass is awesome, and then it failed the day before I was flying home.  He would ask it to play music by some artist, and it would say it was going to play that artist, and then silence.  Nothing.  I power-cycled it and it started working fine.  Then, simply power-cycling it didn't work.  Although the light ring indicated that it recognized the wake word, it wouldn't even tell me the time.  Again, the refurb Dot worked.  A few hours before leaving him to prepare for my flight, I unplugged it and plugged in the Dot; redundancy.  After about an hour, I unplugged the Dot and plugged the new Echo in.  Worked great!  However, I was not confident that it would work for the 3 months I'm away, and didn't have the time to get on the phone with support for a replacement.  Well, it failed again, and I really can't do anything about it other than buy him another.  You see, I've been on the phone with support for another failed Echo, and I doubt that I could get a replacement authorization without being physically present, hence the low score for support.  And after mid-January, I won't be able to have it replaced.  Don't get me wrong, I love the Echo in general.  I have an Echo, Echo Plus, Echo Connect and three Echo Dots.  Statistically, I've had good luck with the Echo products, which is why I purchased a new one for my Dad.  Maybe I'll call support and see if I can get a replacement now, 1500 miles away and unable to touch it.  If I can get a replacement, I'll give it 5 stars, since when it works, the sound is incredible (well, in a nursing home room).

Title: Lovin' These Echo Critters!
Body: I just received my All-new Echo (3rd Generation)- Smart Speaker with Alexa, (RED) edition!I am excited to have a larger Echo, and in the Limited Edition Red! It looks great in my  bedroom and the sound is awesome for such a small device! I got addicted to the even smaller Echo Dots a few months back and now have 9 of them scattered throughout my home, shop and garage. These darn things seem to be multiplying, somewhat like tribbles! So now I have the regular "mommy" sized Echo and a 2nd Red one on the way! I am really enjoying all of these Echo's, and I love this Red one! The red is not as deep looking as what is on the ad, but it is attractive. It's got kind of a coral tinge to it, but it brightens up my room. I'm planning on using the other red one on the other side of my new TV!

I_ a stay at home mom, so I spend most of my time going from room to room cleaning, folding laundry, etc. I got 2 devices. An Echo for the bedroom, and a Show for the dining room. I like to play music on them. It_ like having in-home surround sound but without the expensive installation! I_l definitely be getting more echoes to place around my home to amplify the experience.

Title: Fantastic Sound! Very Impressed!
Body: I am in love with this generation of Echo! I read several of the reviews before purchasing, and previously have only owned the Echo Dot. Wow. What a major sound quality difference! This has become my go-to for music when I'm cooking, cleaning and in general doing anything that needs some motivation around the house. The bass is impressive for such a small thing - nice deep, non-fuzzing lows with some serious thump I actually felt on the floor. (The Echo is placed on my kitchen table) I ran through quite a gamut of music from Home Free, Post Malone, Star Wars instrumental, a little In This Moment and I was pleased with the quality of them all.If you see this lil puppy on sale - snap it right up!I can't wait to host a party and get this Echo bumpin'!

Title: Stereo?
Body: Overall I love this product. Comparable sound quality to other similar priced and size products (JBL Pulse). The main issue for me is I already had a 3rd gen dot. I specifically wanted to buy another Echo product to pair for stereo and have some bass. Originally, I was going to get another dot and the sub. However I grabbed this Echo when it was on sale $60! The sub seems overpriced so I had hoped this would pair with the dot and give me the low end that I needed. I searched everywhere to see if an Echo and a dot would pair and could not find an answer! I had hoped that since both were the newest generation they would pair. NOPE! One workaround, you can play both simultaneously in the same room if you setup multiroom sound. However, the two will still not be stereo which pisses me off. AMAZON please fix this glitch. Why on earth can you not pair ANY two Echo products? Especially the same generation models? So can a Echo and an Echo+ not be paired either?

Title: Works Ok but constantly telling me that it is playing from _insert ridiculously long device name_
Body: I got mine free from Verizon for signing up with Fios and immediately turned off the mic.  The Speaker is fine for what it is and I use it for music and movies and youtube at my desk.  But it periodically yells out "Now Playing from Gg38elskugoksldkfs;odivfsdf" or some odd string of characters and it's always jarring and often times scares the hell out of me.  Sometimes I hear it making that same announcement from the other room when I'm not even using it.  It would be great if they could create a setting that replaces this and all vocal response with a simple series of light flashes.  Ultimately I like this little speaker but this random yelling out issue has got me close to unplugging it.  I just turned on Brief Mode under vocal responses to see if that helps.  "Alexa, please speak only when spoken to".

Title: Great Devices for my Needs
Body: I have been using Echo devices for a couple of years now, i have 18 of them in 2 locations, each time they upgrade I upgrade, I run almost all of my lighting and a few plugs from my echo's, listen to music, have 2 of them and a sub connected thru my HD Fire tv stick for a upgraded movie sound experience that does really good, and i ask questions which alexa usually answers or gives me the information I am asking for. As in any electronics or computer device they have a few bugs that get worked out, the sound quality is great to me, and gets better every time they upgrade, I'm definitely not disappointed.  For the money, they are well worth it. If you want a better sounding speaker go by an expensive speaker that is meant just for being a speaker. They suite my needs very well.

Title: definitely worth the upgrade!
Body: I had a Bose surround sound set up in the family room but was tired of the wires. I had bought a sound bar but wasn_ impressed with the sound when I played my music and watching tv/movies. So I bought 2 of these and paired them as _ront speakers with the new update (I have the Fire Tv Cube). My only gripe is that the volume only goes to 10 which is fine for Amazon Music but when certainty shows or movies with action scenes come into play, it doesn_ sound as loud as I would like it. I plan on purchasing the Echo sub soon and maybe the 2 new Echo Studios when the funds are available. A little pricey at $199 each which output Dolby Atmos. Maybe by then more movies and tv shows will output in that format.

I am still using the V1 unit and often stream on both.  I still have a 5 star rating on the V1, but feel the V3 is a bit of a disappointment.  I will give it more time...

Title: This tech has come pretty far
Body: Ive been waiting to buy any smart products as I didnt want to waste what little mkney i had for tech. I am a student and most of tech budget goes to stuff i want to study. I messed around with alexa and google and siri here and there, but was never all too impressed. The tech has really been streamlined and alexa has learned quite a bit. The voice recognition has significantly improved and the smart gadgets it can control are getting more common. I bought this with an echo show and an echo input and an echo auto. The intercom function has been helpful twice already (10 days of use) and the sound is impressive. I was surprised by how clear and loud it is at max volume. The echo auto, used in conjunction with my echo at home is fantastic. I can control all my lights, my tv, my xbox, and more from my car. From anywhere, actually. More awesome is the fact that my car is not a cornucopia of technological advancements. All i have in there is a cigarette lighter and an aux input. All things considered, this product, and several of its other echo partners, was an awesome purchase. Especially at sale prices!5 stars.

Title: Alexa is my hero
Body: I bought this and was not sure I really wanted it. I mostly wanted a speaker to stream my music while I worked... but oh my god. Alexa is my new love (sorry Siri). One thing I love is how she can add things to my shopping or to-do lists so easily and it goes right into the app. This helps when I lay awake at night unable to sleep because I know I need to make a list of things to do the next day... so I can get it quickly off my mind and go to bed.Well, I loved it so much I bought 2 echo dots. One for the kitchen and one for the kids room so now I can easily drop into the kids room and let them know dinner is ready without having to march up the stairs or scream like a banshee.

Title: Sounds ok
Body: I bought this because I wanted better sound for my music. The quality is not any better than the dot. It is louder but no base for the music i like to listen to. Save your money and just buy a good blue tooth speaker.

Title: Going from the echo dot to the echo is a big difference in sound
Body: I currently own the echo dot 2 and a couple of the 3rd generation dots. I would always listen to my Amazon Music playlist while I cleaned around the house. I needed something with a bit more volume and sound so I went with this 3rd generation echo. The difference is definitely worth the upgrade. Voice recognition is better among other things. I love all of the features that Alexa has to offer. My son who is almost two has just recently started talking and he will randomly blurt of "lexa playyyy shots!". Of course he doesn't emphasize the A in Alexa so I help him out a bit and he gets a big ole grin on his face when Lil Jon and LMFAO start to play. The Alexa skills are great. The Guard mode when away also allows Alexa to listen for smoke alarms and glass breaking. This would result in a notification pushed to your phone. I would love for them to ad a feature that allowed several echo's to monitor these sounds while home. With one in the basement, kitchen, living room, and upstairs bedroom, It would be amazing if Alexa could hear a smoke detector from the basement or kitchen and then alert my bedroom echo with a very loud alarm. This would allow me to wake up much sooner since it takes a bit for smoke to get upstairs. Even then, Its hard to hear a smoke alarm in a hallway when you run a fan or window AC all night. Who wouldn't want to get out of the house before a fire got out of control? Amazon....please consider this feature. It would definitely save lives. It could even save households that keep fire extinguishers on hand. Anyways, buy this echo. You won't regret it.

Title: Only works with Amazon music :'(
Body: I regretted this purchase and returned the item. I bought this because I have a big living room and I wanted to have a great sound system playing on multiple devices at the same time. Unfortunately this only works with Amazon music!My music provider is Google play music, where I have all my Playlist and saved videos, and YouTube. There was no way to play my music on the speaker. I was so shocked I thought it was user error, so I contacted customer service and they confirmed that there was no way to play my music from Google play music to this speaker.In general I've found these Echo devices really difficult to setup, you need wifi and Bluetooth and it only works for Amazon music, and it only works when plugged in.I'm so used to regular speakers that have a battery, and that just work over Bluetooth. I'm very disappointed with Amazon Echo devices.I ended returning this product.Pros :- quick shippingCons:- only works with Amazon music, doesn't work with YouTube or Google play music- hard to setup, hard to tell when the device is plugged in or not

Title: Great Sound and Fun Color
Body: This has a slightly more full bodied sound than the Second Generation echo that is very clear with a warm tone. For me, the difference isn't great enough to make it the single most important reason for the upgrade, but the line in jack was what sold me.  I wanted something for the devices I have that do not have Bluetooth and the slightly bigger sound is just a nice bonus. As usual it is easy to set up and performs as expected.Even though I can't make a stereo pairing with my Second Gen Echo, having them at opposite ends of the room and creating a group for them mmore than fills the room with very nice sounding audio so am quite pleased with my purchase.

Not to mention the endless other features and skills these devices have.

Title: Quality Sound
Body: This new Echo has very good quality sound. It took the place of an Echo Dot (smaller unit) that was in our living room. The Dot worked great however we moved it to the bedroom and replaced it with the Echo and as a result it provides great sound, clearer audio and it looks great as well. We found that we can use a lower sound setting and achieve clear sound and great volume. We like both units and now they are in locations that suit them best.  We use them for our 6 wi-fi outlets as well and they work great through the Alexa app or voice command. I highly recommend either one of these units. Just consider up front the size area and type of sound quality you are looking for. Thanks!

Title: Great speaker with a serious flaw.
Body: The sound quality is excellent and the Alexa function is great. However, there is one serious flaw of the echo. When playing music over Bluetooth, the volume is extremely low. It needs to turn all the way up to have a reasonable volume for music. But by then, the Alexa volume is way too loud. Sadly, there is no way to sync the volume level of the music and Alexa. Another minor glitch is when playing amazon music to stereo pair of echo, there is always a few seconds of noise before the music starts. It would be to mute them before the music starts.

Title: No YouTube music. :(
Body: A little buggy. Has trouble switching between different devices streaming to it. Had to delete and reinstall the app to get it to work with my TV.  I have both the Echo and the Dot and the multi-room music works well. Only complaint right now is that there is no integration with YouTube Music. I can't have Alexa play music from YouTube Music without streaming directly from my phone,  which defeats the purpose.  Amazon's unlimited music service is less than half the cost of YouTube Premium, so that's a good reason to switch I guess- but then I lose the ability to watch ad-free videos on YouTube.  Maybe I just talked myself into it.  I don't really watch YouTube videos. I'll probably check out the library on Amazon Unlimited Music and see if it compares.

Title: Get a pair and add the subwoofer! <3
Body: I bought two of these little gems, with a sub woofer. I synced  them all together to create my own little home sound system. The deep base of the subwoofer really adds to the already well-balanced sound of the third generation devices. I_ not super excited about the voice recognition. I gave it four stars. I_ hoping that as these devices learn how I talk, and the technology gets better, it will be more smooth to use. Right now, Alexa only gets 2-3 out of five commands right. That_ frustrating! The sound, though... makes this purchase worth it.

Title: Amazon can't even make it pair with a phone!
Body: I gave my mom an Echo and I just wanted to pair with it to play Christmas music and when I try to pair Amazon's incompetent designers want to force me to use the app and then, apparently, take the device from my mom's account and add it to mine! All I want to do is pair my phone to her Echo and play some music. EVERY other bluetooth speaker manufacturer seems to understand that. Don't waste your money on this thing. Even trying to play music over Amazon Music can be painful thanks to the problematic speech recognition - it's pretty good for basic use, but for album and song titles it's extremely flaky. It normally defaults to playing the title track of an album rather than the entire album, for instance.Unfortunately Amazon won't allow me to submit a review with no stars whatsoever.

Title: Great to play music and love mute
Body: I got this to play music while doing household work and cooking.  I love the timer and I love most of the little weather things I get.  I do not have a smart house so it is limited use.  But I do love the sound quality.  I also enjoy that if I do not want anything to be heard I can hit a mute button (not that I have anything to hide).  But love the option.

Title: Alexa. Where would I be without you!
Body: i had the 1st generation Echo that I bought from a friend in 2016. I loved it. The sound quality was amazing. It did amazing things. I played fun games on it. I got the weather. I set timers. I made shopping lists. I shopped on Amazon with it. Alexa woke me up. Alexa said good night. She turned on my lights and even set light timers for me. In time there won't be anything that we can't do with Alexa. She just keeps getting better and better and I have seen that progress since I first plugged her in back in 2016. I traded in my 1st gen Echo though Amazon. I told them the condition and right on the spot I had my trade in money to use towards the new 3rd gen Echo. They even gave me a shipping label to send it back to them and when they got it there was no issue with the trade in value I received.This new 3rd gen echo is great. The sound quality is far better than the 1st gen and that one sounded great regardless of how loud I played music. Alexa keeps getting better and am happy to have one.. well many now as I have one in each room. Highly recommended. It is life changing and the price is incredible for what you are getting and all the different ways you can use Alexa. I can't wait to see what happens next.

Title: Wanted it to be perfect.
Body: I ordered the new third generation Echo on Black Friday. What upset me right off the bat is that it was shipped to me in a flimsy Tyvek envelope. No extra packing for protection. As for the unit itself, it  is very similar to the second generation Echo. The sound is a little bolder with more base response. The only issue, so far, is with the end of request response sound when it is switched on in settings. For no apparent reason, it occasionally blares at full volume at the end of request response. The only remedy is to turn off the end of request sound in settings. No such issue with my first and second generation Echoes.

Doesn't Amazon make enough $$$?  If I'm listening to a symphony, or sacred music to be played while I meditate or pray, advertising totally inappropriate.  Let the buyer beware.

Title: Great for the price.
Body: So, after buying and trying a couple of echo dots, I bought 2 of these 3rd gen echo_. I must say I was quite impressed with the sound after the dots. I also paired with an echo sub and a 4K Firetv Stick. With the Alexa app, the capability is there to set up a _heater system. Actually it works pretty well. Setup took about 15 minutes including the speaker software/firmware updates.Sound.....So I_e had for the last 20 years a 5.1 system with different high end receivers and Paradigm speakers. Now, I was NOT looking to duplicate the sound that system produced but, I was looking for something decent. Actually these 3rd gen_ paired with the little echo sub do pretty well. I_e actually had quite a few people over that had in the past enjoyed my other system for _ovie nights or just sitting around playing cards listening to music, and they_e all been impressed. Enough so that most are looking at setting up the same system at home.I_ not going down the road of specs and stats. I_ just going to say I_ impressed and would purchase all again.I_ hoping in the future there will be a firmware/software update that will integrate these speakers into a full surround. A 5.1 or even a 5.2 would be super.For now I_ extremely happy with them. For the price they_e great.If you_e an idiot looking for super audio file sound or Einstein knowledge for speakers then keep looking. I must say some of the 1 and 2 star reviews I read are, well, idiotic.

Title: Bug: "NOW CONNECTED TO ...."

Title: Great way to enjoy music
Body: Generally Alexa is fairly good at finding more common music from a more recent era but a bit rusty on years gone by. She might recognize "Blue Skies" but not "Boulevard of Broken Dreams". She fails at Classical Music as well. I prefer to send her to my Pandora collections because I know what type of music I will get. She does well with Broadway though! Since she is coming into the house by Wi-Fi connection, I wish she could play my music on my Windows 10 computer like she does for Pandora when we set her up. App setup for Windows 10 computers from Amazon does not work and produces errors which technicians do not solve and wish to sell technical services from $150. The Alexa App is free from the Microsoft store, installed by me after I declined their help and my unit works well on all my devices - computers, cell phones, Fire HD's and tablets.

Title: Line -In (Aux) does not work yet remains a feature in the description
Body: I purchased this Gen 3 speaker yeaterday. I have two others, the Tap and the Original Echo that I am generally pleased with. The Gen 3 was for a special purpose, I needed to connect a wired Audio source to it. After checking the specifications, I see it has a Line-In. Actually, its a Line-In / Line-Out connection configurable in software or supposed to be.After setting up, I proceeded to connect the Line-In (Aux) and opened the Alexa app on my iPhone. I found the Line-In/Line-Out switch and changed it to Line-In. At this point, the app crashed and said something went wrong. It would just refresh the screen not allowing you to toggle the Aux to Line-In. After reading some old reviews, I learned about a problem with the iOS app. So, I had an Android tablet around, I opened the Alexa app on it and found the Line-In switch. Again, I activate it. The app did not crash this time but no audio came out.I contacted Amazon device support who franly did not know what Line-In or Aux was. After 10 minutes of wasted time on chat, the CS person came back with "That device does not support Line-IN". I refered him to the current listing which lists Line-In as a feature.The device was returned to the store as Faulty. Today, I purchased an Awsome Ears Boom 2LE from a local brick and mortar store and WOW, what a device. A smart app that works, Line-In that works, sound that is far better than the current echo's, and a useful equalizer to customize the speakers tonal quality. $60.

Title: If I was a billionaire, I'd buy the whole world other home speaker products.
Body: I can't know what you want this product for, but if you're like me and many of my friends, having it play music (supposedly of your choosing) is a big deal for you. And in that respect, it sucks. I've had more arguments with Alexa about what music it is I'm trying to listen to than I ever imagined possible. And then when it finally (if ever) gets to the type of playlist I'm looking for, the playlist gets so repetitive after a few listens I can predict the songs coming up. It honestly got so bad I pulled out my old 3-CD changer stereo and hooked that up for listening to music while I get ready for work in the morning. You can't tell Alexa to not play certain songs or bands, nor can you go into your Amazon account to request the same (a feature that seems easy to implement, but Amazon certainly hasn't since I mentioned it to them over a year ago). The only credit I can give the echo is it has decent sound, but considering it's lack of functionality and poor AI, I'll stick with an old school home stereo and a music service through my phone.

Title: Buggy
Body: I hope Amazon will have a future fix / update.  I have my speakers paired and run them in stereo.  The set up was easy.  To me, the sound quality is pretty good (I have amateur ears, I_ no sound expert).  But sometimes one speaker will stop playing in the middle of a song and start a new song while the other speaker continues playing the original song.  This happens often.  Then I have to tell Alexa to stop, then start again.  This is annoying.  Especially in a song I like.  I_ hoping because the 3rd generation is new,  this is a bug that will soon be fixed.
