Title: English and Spanish @ the same time, cool!
Body: It is super cool that you can speak both English and Spanish at the same time to Alexa. I honestly thought that was not possible. This is the feature that I appreciate the most, since it is very useful to me when I am asking Alexa to play Cumbias in Spotify. The sound quality is superb, I have linked my echo to My fire TV stick and now when I I'm watching a movie the sound quality improved tremendously, it did the job as a soundbar. So I could say that you can probably call it a "smart soundbar". When I got this gift it included a Smart switch from Kasa and it makes it very easy to turn on and off my room lamp through echo. Overall I can say that I am pretty satisfied with the quality of the sound and the easiness of which Alexa understands both languages.

Title: Don'y waste your money
Body: I just recently bought this device, I've had another one for a few years but I thought something was wrong with it, as looped sounds kept cutting off. Well I am having the same issue with this one. I use it for playing sleep sounds and now it cuts off every few minutes or cuts off all together, the exact same thing that had begun happening with my old device. I did some research and have since found out lots of people have been reporting this problem. It's bad enough Amazon farms their skills out to third party developers who are now trying to get people to pay for them, so you get long annoying ads as well as constant prompts for a 5 star review on your device..... (I've also seen where even if you get a subscription half the time it doesn't work and Amazon does nothing about it) but the looping problem is directly related to Amazon's product as it happens on the old and new devices and also happens when trying to loop music...think next time I will give Google assistant a try, maybe they make their own skills for their own device.

Title: Sounds better then the 2nd generation one!
Body: This is our second Echo unit since the first one ended up in my 18 years old boy's room after couple of weeks of sitting in the kitchen.  I think the 3rd gen. sounds even better than the previous one was. More bass, more depth to the overall sound. The only thing came right off as a negative impression was the shape. The 2 gen. was a sleek, very stylish piece of electronics that you could easily blend in with your other stuff in any room in the house. The fabric that covered the speakers and the shape of the tower itself gave you more opportunity to place it among anything basically. This one is chubbier and a bit duller. It's not a deal breaker at all, just an observation. I guess the better sound quality means bigger speaker units means increased circumference means chubbier looks. Besides the difference in the aesthetics it is a great product!

The echo plays music upon request and can be used to phone people although they did seem to have a little trouble hearing me if I was not close to the echo. Title: Amazing little device
Body: I am not a tech type person at all.  I like music and happen to think of songs often and wonder who the artist is or want to hear the song, for this reason I give this little device rave reviews.  I am not all concerned with invasion of privacy much as all things have invaded and negatively impacted our privacy and health- nothing is as it seems, may as well enjoy some perks while getting the shaft.  The sound is great in a space of 500 sq ft., is responsive to my voice but I don't make request like I am talking to a human, there's no kids yelling to it, my house is quiet which may impact how Alexa software responds.  It's a new concept/device and as with most new things, it's not perfect.  And with all man-made things, it never will be.

Title: I do not like that everything you say to the device is recorded.
Body: I personally did not like the fact that everything I said was recorded. Even when it wasn_ supposed to be and I was not speaking to it. The app that I downloaded on my phone showed an allowed me to listen to what was recorded and there were several recordings where I was not talking to the device. The sound quality was good whenever I play music, but I just think it is 100% important for people to have this device to realize that nothing should be said that you would not say in front of the world. If you don_ have a problem with that then I suggest you get this product. I have to say that it is really cool to be able to turn on and off your lights and other appliances with this device. So it_ really up to the individual and how much privacy they would like to have.

Title: Next Generation Alexa looks and works great
Body: I purchased this A-Lady for my daughter as a gift.  I have a first-generation model. This one looks a bit more modern and works just fine.  The price is lower (Black Friday had a nice discount) and the unit is a bit smaller than the first-generation. I've come to rely on her for timers while cooking, reminders for every day stuff, alarms for those times I need to set a non-standard alarm (catch a plane for example), etc.  I love the lists  I have one for Walmart, groceries, Costco, Sams Club. It makes shopping so much easier to just be able to add X to the grocery list right when you run out.  A must-have to turn on lights in the house. Great to ask "How old is Actor X" when you see them in a movie.  The A-Lady has become an important part of the family - glad to be sharing the experience with my daughters.

Title: Subwoofer pairing does not support Line/In feature
Body: Pros: Versatile and when paired with the echo sub is a good alternative to a more expensive sound system.Cons: the line/in feature does not support the subwoofer. Title: Do not buy for Home theater sound!! Not worth it!
Body: So I ordered two of these echos and 1 sub for 2.1 home theater surround sound. Big fan of amazon products. Very disappointed with the home theater set up and if your buying for that purpose, it_ not worth it. I_ running on 5ghz. There is always an issue. One side it working and the other isn_. Then it swaps, then they both work but the sub is not working. If you watch tv in the early mornings like 5-6am, forget about it. No sound because the devices are unreachable for some reason. Then you have to unpair and pair them again(some devices would still show unreachable. Then you gotta unplug device and plug again). There are set up in my living room where my WiFi is. My point is that it_ not seamless connect, since I got it I_e always been playing around with it to make it stay connected. Gotten to the point where I disconnected it and just hearing sound through my TV. Thinking about returning an echo and sub as I don_ need two echos and I_ not going to have a sub laying around for no reason. Oh and to connect musics, forget about it. The app is horrible for music. I can_ even choose a song from my Apple Music to play. I had to create a playlist for amazon on my Apple app and in the amazon app I can_ even choose the song I want to play or even shuffle the music! This is a complete fail and amazon let me down on this one. The sound on the echo itself is decent.

Title: Incredible Value!
Body: This product is fantastic. For about 6 years I owned a popular mini speaker that rhymes with _ose, _hows and _lows (I think you can figure it out) that cost more than double what the echo costs. As much as I hated the fact that I owned one of these _rand name speaker, it actually sounded impressive for its small size, so impressive that I had it for 6 years. When I was contemplating buying some smart speaker, I was tempted with the Sonos for its sound quality and reputation but the price tag always seemed high. I bought the echo on a whim, as it were, and I_ thoroughly impressed. Not only does it put my old speaker to shame in terms of sound, ease of use and looks, the multi-room music and home-theater configuration options are second to none. After 2 days of owning this speaker, I bought another and bought an echo plus for another room in my house. Don_ get me wrong, it_ still a smaller size speaker and doesn_ have the power of some bigger speaker out there, where you will be blown away is the value of the speaker. I haven_ seen a speaker this small and at this dollar amount perform as well as this speaker. 10/10 would recommended.

Title: Great sound but be prepared for a learning curve on how to command your Echo!
Body: Received my echo 3rd Gen unit over the holidays due to an ongoing promotion. It has great sound over the Dot version hands down - good base and highs. It takes a bit of investment of your time to learn all the nuances of what Alexa can do for you. With the app, you can set up your Echo to be an alarm clock, timer, grocery list, teach it a routine for each day (like giving the weather forecast, the latest news from a specific news source, turn on/turn off lights, thermostat control, play specific music (classical, rock, pop) etc.). But beware, the instructions for all this are not included with your Echo. You have to dig around (through e-books, YouTube, etc.) to become familiar with the commands and required outcomes. For example, my unit began to display a pulsating yellow light that became annoying at night in my bedroom. I couldn_ turn it off except by disconnecting the power. Of course, this could_e become a deal breaker if I had to disconnect every nite (I kept all the shipping package just in case I needed to return it). Well, it turned out that this was one way the Echo communicates with you. It was trying to tell me It had a notification for me to listen to. Until I asked, _lexa, do I have any notification? the yellow pulsating light would_e continued. Immediately after delivering all notifications, the yellow pulsating light stopped. By the way, the notifications were about shipping/delivery of packages coming from, wait for it...Amazon. Of course, other types of notifications are possible pending how you program your Echo. Like I said, this simple issue would_e been a deal breaker for me if I hadn_ decided to invest some of my time in trying to resolve this simple problem. It wasn_ until I learned how to communicate with my Echo that the problem wouldn_ go away. But again, the answer was not included with this product. My feedback to Amazon would be to include a list of commands and a trouble shooting section for the buyer. By employing this one simple act, I_ sure these products would be in far more demand by their customers once they learn the how to_ of communicating with these aliens. Beginning to love my Echo!

Title: much better than gen 1 echo
Body: I actually like the gen 1 tower's looks, but this short echo in a light blue cloak is cuter. the clincher was the 3mm line in/out port which offers a myriad of flexibility. the sound is quite good - even too loud at max. I do have one suggestion and that is to offer a real amplified out rather than line out, so I can drive an external pair of non-amplified speakers. this would require speaker hookups, so I don't imagine this suggestion would be taken up.

Title: Dementia and Alzhermer_ Disease
Body: I am almost totally satisfied with this device. I use it daily and frequently to help me get through the day. I have recently had to put my wife in a memory care facility, because she has dementia. I had hoped she could use the device, but it_ too complicated for her in her condition. She has no short-term memory at this time, and still can_ remember how to operate the device. Also, the change in volume level as music is played, frustrates her. At one moment it is too soft, at the next it is too loud. Too bad it doesn_ have AVC, Automatic volume control such as we have on radios.

Title: not perfected yet
Body: I love the way the alexa 3 gen sounds but it is still lacking in a lot of ways.. especially when it comes to setting up light bulbs.  I bought 2 different kind including the one that was part of the package put together by amazon and I couldn't get them to hook up at all. My neighbor next door had the same problem but he broke down and bought a hub so the worked thru that not the alexa itself.  I had no trouble with the outlets.  Problem with that is if the wifi goes out you have to climb behind your furniture to unplug your outlets to be able to use what ever you had plugged into them..Remember if you have wifi that goes out you don't want everything to be a smart device thru the alexa.  Alexa does not work for anything if the wifi goes out.As I said earlier the sound quality of music is really great. Volume is really good as well. It goes about as loud as a person could want.I also attempted using amazons templates for making a skill. They need to work on their templates a a couple of them were not working properly to be able to share what you taught it to make.. Shame I had really high hopes for this device.

Title: Great Sounds Quality and LOUD
Body: I got this for my wife as she enjoys listening to music with our kids. She's been using her phone and our TV up to this point for her music needs and the sound quality is just not there. This speaker allows her to be able to use Bluetooth, Aux. port, or Amazon Music. I purchased this speaker instead of a normal Bluetooth speaker for the "Smart" features of it. I got the Echo instead of the Dot for the Woofer (bass) for music. Our whole family loves talking to Alexa, and we can also use the smart feature of Alexa for other things than just music. I would say, so far, we are extremely happy with this purchase.

Title: No battery = no fun.
Body: I had an earlier Alexa product that I loved.  Once it was uncharged I could unplug it and carry it around the house with me.  I used it for music and news, mostly, as well as occasional info queries.  I am disappointed with this new Echo.  It has much better sound quality than the old one.  But it is bulky and heavy and does not have a battery.  So I find myself rarely using it.  When I do unplug it and carry it to a new outlet, it takes too long to charge up and become responsive.  I will need to get a battery attachment, but that will only add more bulk & weight -- and cost!

Title: Big improvement. Well done
Body: I upgraded from 1st Gen.  to the 3rd Gen. due to newer hardware and because the 1st Generation wasn_ working as smoothly.Set up was super easy. If you are up grading, there no need to type in your network info. Because your info is already in your account  The Echo tech that helped me was very patient and worked with me for over 2hrs. He went above and beyond. We tried every situation to hook the 1st Gen to the different groups of speakers. Firgured that there was something wrong with it. Title: 1st gen has better operation overall, disappointed.
Body: I've been a echo owner since the 1st gen... this thing is garbage compared to the 1st gen. Yes, sound quality is way better but it crackles and pops when waking her. It sounds broken, flat out. Tech support says this is normal. Nope, 1st gen did not do this garbage. That's not even the worst part. I use my echos as my preliminary music listening devices. I pay a premium for unlimited and HD music from Amaxon. Both of the latest gen echos I bought randomly disconnect ALL THE TIME and randomly stop playing music for no reason. They're supposed to be new tech, but honestly the 1st gen worked way more flawlessly. Major bugs and kinks that I have zero faith in Amazon addressing before they shove the newest gen dow your throat.

Title: Very happy with it. Good sound quality.
Body: I've had an echo dot (2nd gen) for awhile, so I was already accustom to interfacing with Alexa.  I used the dot primarily as a music player, and had it plugged in to a boombox-type of unit to improve the sound quality.  After reading about the Echo smart speaker's sound quality, I decided to give it a try.  I was immediately very pleased with the sound quality, and after doing a side-by-side comparison with the echo-dot-and-boombox arrangement, the new Echo smart speaker quickly replaced my former setup.  It has surprisingly good bass performance, considering its size, and reminds me of the sound quality of what I would call a "table radio" (for those old enough to remember such things).  All in all, I am very happy with this item.

Title: Excellent sound quality
Body: Aside from all the things the Echo is able to do, we purchased this device for my daughter who is a high school dance major. She has to practice her choreography a lot and is constantly having to stop and go over to her phone to replay or rewind her music. Being able to speak to Alexa and have her pause or rewind a song however many seconds needed has been really helpful to my daughter. It allows her to focus more on her dance without losing momentum or focus. The sound quality is excellent. We have enjoyed using the Echo, as well, for all the other added conveniences a smart device brings to the home and I can see us purchasing a few more in the future.

Title: A Fantastic and Convenient Product, but I Have Concerns about Privacy After Seeing a Few Articles
Body: I mostly use this product for listening to music. It's worked for me thus far and adding songs to my playlist is convenient. I'm just a little concerned about the "always on" microphone. Seems like it could easily be used as a wiretap, and judging from some articles, that is a major concern for this product. I'm definitely uneasy about it keeping a record of anything I say, and while the policy claims it's not spying on customers, it's difficult to know if that's legitimately true or just a claim to avoid potential lawsuits.

The ai is amazing and the voice response sounds so human and not robotic.  While the sound quality is much better than your typical speaker, it_ not studio quality.  It sure is loud though which is great.  You can naturally talk to it using phrases like _k enough when you want to stop an action.  You don_ have to talk to it like it_ a robot and worry about saying the _ight commands.  It understands you and just works.  I_e bought 5 of them in the past week lol, and the studio is on its way tomorrow.  It also works flawlessly with the smart device in my home

Title: First generation is definitely more Superior than this 3rd generation
Body: this version is not comfortable to the first generation. First of all the  bass sound is adjusted to take over and often times it causes discomfort to listen to even when the bass is adjusted to the lowest available level . The voice recognition is also less Superior than the first generation. It often has Hang Ups and a red circle indicating its inability to respond to a question or at a speed at which comprable to the first generation Alexa. We had the worst time connecting it to our Wi-Fi this time. Overall we are not pleased with the change in the base which causes literally the floor to vibrate even said at the lowest level. This takes away from the actual music that's being played and we have to adjust the volume down just so we can have less Bass which compromises the listening experience. I find this Alexa to not be an improvement to the first-generation and I wish I could buy another first-generation which broke recently.  I I am very disappointed in this new generation  which I was looking forward to and thought would be even a greater version from the first generation. If it weren't for the fact that Alexa Can Read Wikipedia entries I would have purchased my personal assistant from another company.

Title: unreliable
Body: When I first got this item as a gift, I thought it was really cool.  A few days later, Alexa did not respond to my voice at all.  The lights came on but shut off immediately after I asked her to play some music.  Last night, I asked her to play a specific artist.  She stated that she could not unless I pay, but she could play something similar.  The entire hour she played something similar, the music was static, and came in and out.  Have called my son several times since he gave me the item as a gift.  He said he didn't know why the item would be acting up.  No longer amused by this item.

Title: First one inexplicably failed
Body: Amazon keeps hassling for a right up, so here's some truth.  The Amazon products seem to be VERY VERY cheaply made and burn themselves out, just after the first year.  If you grow dependent on them, you'll have to continually replace them at your cost.  Solid State electronics should not burn themselves out, they should last years not months!  A decently manufactured product should last for years, but these devises are not that.  If Amazon wants my opinion, I would say they should build better quality products!!!The new replacement seems to wax in it's ears and it frequently takes longer to preform simple tasks like turning on the lights.  Sure it wasn't as expensive as the first one I bought, but I am very unlikely to keep buying units because the burn themselves out.  !@#$% the shareholders!  Amazon seem to make huge amounts of money and I am unhappy they are going down this path where users need to replace their garbage every year or two.Hey all you "Green" people out there, certainly lousy corporate strategies that rob from the customer and and are horribly just filling up landfills is a really bad strategy, particularly at the scale Amazon sales are.  If you represent a Green charity or concern, maybe your organization can attack Amazon and have them create a decent product instead of robbing from their customers having to continually buy replacements.  Besides the low down despicable ethics, it seems really bad for our environment.  Cheap lousy products are waste of time, money, and our planet's limited resources, but I'm sure some near looser at Amazon got a raise for developing a product that burns it's self out after a few months.  But the rest of the world should prosecute them for the waste it is.  Anyways, Amazon keeps sending me emails like they think I would like their product.  Quite the contrary, I find their practice of designing these horrible products to burn themselves out is utterly despicable and a huge loss for our fragile environment.

Title: Impressive sound quality!
Body: I bought the Echo and Sub combination, and we really like the sound quality of this system. We're still training Alexa, but so far, she appears to be behaving well. The Sub Woofer adds a lot more sound, and makes the system fill the room with music. I put an Echo with the Sub, in our living room area, and I was so impressed with the sound quality, that I'm now going to add an Echo and Sub, to our dining room area, and the master bedroom.

Title: Poor WiFi performance compared to Echo dot
Body: I got this Echo to replace an Echo Dot & get the improved sound quality.The sound quality is indeed excellent.  The Alexa integration works just fine, and the voice quality & recognition are excellent.  What's not to love?Well, the problem is poor WiFi performance.  I give it 5 stars for voice, integration and sound.  However, the WiFir performance - an absolutely critical element - is poor at best.  One star for that.I have reset the device several times, moved it around the room, and done everything I can but it just has poor WiFi.  The Echo Dot I replaced could stay connected and stream literally all day long without hitch in exactly the same spot with the same WiFi. This unit, on the same WiFi, the same day, could not stream for 5 minutes before skipping and losing connection on any of several tests.As a final test, I connected it to a WiFi unit in the same room. No problem - it works beautifully if it is literally in the same room as the 802.11 device. That's not practical.I am a huge fan of Alexa & the Echo's (sounds like an 80's band name) but this Echo hits a sour note.  I don't know if it is firmware or the chip set that is poor, but it's just not up to Amazon's previous device standards.

Title: This speaker is great!
Body: I have a Dot in nearly every room, many of them grouped for stereo and an Echo Sub. As this new Echo (3rd gen) was released, I got excited by learning the previous version, the Echo Plus, was compatible to group for stereo. So I purchased this and another Echo Sub and set it up in what we call our yoga room. It_ been great and I find myself just sitting in the room to listen to music. All that said, the Alexa service isn_ perfect yet. She has moments of inoperability and it_ super annoying when Alexa doesn_ hear you correctly or just stops playing altogether. But that is a different issue than the hardware. This speaker is great and I recommend it. (Note: This speaker does not have the hub feature, so get the Echo Plus if that_ what you require.)

Title: Echo Gen 1 vs Gen 2
Body: The new Echo seems to do everything as well as my Gen 1 unit, but the new speakers provide deeper bass.The one difference I didn_ see as an improvement was that changing the volume manually on the new unit is done by pressing a + or - button instead of turning the rotating ring used on the Gen 1. Using these buttons, especially in the dark, is a hit or miss proposition, especially since there are 4 of them, all the same size, so no way to distinguish by feel. The ring was not only more intuitive, but I always got the desired result. I know that volume can be adjusted by voice, but then you can_ hear the program material as Alexa changes the volume. This is a minor complaint, more of an observation.One thing I really like is being able to synchronize playback on both units. I will probably add a third unit to get music (or whatever) playing throughout the house.

Title: Easy set up w/Amazon pre-configured
Body: The sound quality is noticeably better than the Echo Dot. It was very easy to set up as it was shipped pre-configured for my account. Very much a plug and play device. The downloadable app is worth adding to a smartphone as it allows for additional configuration and tools for smart home. Placed the Echo in my bedroom to help with morning and evening routines. It is my first Echo device and have found the convenience of the functions to be both good utility and fun technology to use. Set up a routine to turn out the lights, say the weather forecast for the morning commute, and play music to fall asleep to. Then another routine to wake up to an alarm, turn on the light at 50% brightness, say the current weather and traffic, a daily briefing of selected news, then play motivational music to wake up. Makes it harder surf the snooze buttons on the alarm clocks. The utility is much more than just a speaker. No issues with shipping or the device.

They all work well but this was a draw back that I feel Amazon does not go out of it's way to make clear.

Body: We originally purchased a first generation Alexa when they came out. It is a great device that we still use in another part of the house now that we have this newer generation version. Aside from it being a little shorter and more stout, it's otherwise no different whatsoever from the first generation. The one exception to that is the sound. The bass is just slightly better on the new device, but not a lot to make an impact. Sound is still dull, with no defining highs or lows, just more a blaring mid range sound. If they can fix this or offer a device with much better audio, we'd get that. Is it with the money to upgrade from a Gen1? I'd say no, not yet.

Body: A good device overall, but often it fails to understand trivial requests. Good sound quality, great voice recognition (even from across the room), poor/fair understanding of what I meant it to do.

Title: Awesome when working properly
Body: Absolutely love this when it_ working properly! It has great sound when working but there are sometimes volume issues (Music volume is almost silent when all the way turned up but then Alexa voice is extremely loud) . I_e also had issues with the lights on the Alexa. They consistently stay on even when I_ not talking to her and also when there are no notifications. After leaving unplugged for a few hours it comes back on and works fine, I just wish I didn_ have to keep resetting it. It will sometimes go a day or more without working properly.

Title: Complete junk. Unresponsive. Stick with the 2nd generation
Body: Before I write my review let me say that I install over 300 Amazon echos every year for my company in brand new homes. I even own 9 Amazon echos in my own home and vehicle.Prior to using this Amazon Echo 3rd generation I had Amazon Echo 2nd generation speakers in my living room set up as a theater system group. They worked great! Each Echo had a different wake up work so I can speak to that particular Amazon Echo. One Amazon Echo was set up as left speaker and one was set up as right speaker. I decided to upgrade my Amazon echos to the 3rd Generation Amazon Echo. After setting them up the same way I had my 2nd generation setup I can tell you that I am completely dissatisfied. although these speakers works great in a theater group when watching TV, use the wake up word Alexa to call my right Amazon Echo the light ring will respond but the echo with the Wake word Echo response verbally instead. If I remove the Amazon echos from the theater group The correct Echo will respond. I contacted technical support and they are completely clueless. I then decided to test out my whole house group that I use quite often to play my music in every room. Most of the time my speakers don't respond at all and they don't play music. if they do respond , only 1 Amazon Echo plays the music even though these Amazon echos are in the same group that I asked to play. When I tried to tell them to stop , they acknowledge me speaking to them but do not stop playing the music. It became extremely frustrating to the point where I was yelling at my echo With no response. Amazon really needs to go back to the drawing board on this 3rd generation and fix their bugs.

Title: MS Dos, (Windows), users Heads Up
Body: I got Alexa for radio, pod casts, and the occasional song. Audio is clear and loud with a smaller foot print than the radio/computer. Simply tell Alexa the station ID, and it will change stations.  Before I bought this device, I verified it would work with Windows 7, since it must be connected to a wireless modem using your home computer. (I do not have an i-phone.) When I tried to download the Alexa application software, the download would not finish due to my inadequate web security software. I had to purchase web security software and the help desk cleaned my disk of files I didn't even know I had. My machine runs much faster and Alexa works great. The help desk was very helpful and answered any question/concern I had.  Maybe if I had Apple based computer at home or an i-phone this wouldn't have been a problem??

Maybe the Echo data base will eventually expand and those questions will be answered? Otherwise, I'm content for now.

Title: Best assistant out there.
Body: It does pretty good recognizing what we say. We were able to put both of our Amazon accounts in it. For the size of the speaker, it actually sounds great. I was able to set up a voice command that controls all of the Christmas decorations in the house, which are spread out over 8 different Outlets. Turning them on and off became a house tour everyday. The adapter plugs were 4 for $20, relatively inexpensive. Next I'm going to replace one or two light switches, not all of them. Definitely the main one in the living room with the dimmer, so I can just dim the lights with a voice command. You don't have to buy expensive WiFi bulbs, you can actually replace the outlets and light switches if you want, or buy Outlet adapters if you only want one of the two outlets to be controllable. My only word of caution would be there that recordes everything you say after the Wake word, so you may want to go in now and then and delete your recordings. They say this will affect how well it recognizes your voice, but so far I don't see that happening. I have friends who use the Google and Siri products. They don't seem to work nearly as well as this does.

Of course, that costs extra, as do most of the really cool things I would want to do. Also, it seems easily confused. I don't know: Maybe this one has baggage from not getting along with the other Alexa's in the warehouse.

Title: Great quality in 3rd generation -- but NOT a TRUE red!
Body: This is an excellent product---3rd generation has even better sound quality than 2nd Gen. BUT, I was expecting RED, and the color is more an orange/coral, and NOT a true (fire engine) red; it has much more an dark orange appearance, with a white top (dirty fingerprints magnet) and a white plug and cord. I think this should be a true red if it's being sold as such, and should be also offered with a black top/cord/plug as an option. I gave mine to a friend, and he bought me a 3rd Gen in Charcoal, which is my preferred color. Had this been a TRUE RED, I would have hung onto it. If you like an orangey/coral color---go for it; just know that a "conceptual" design of red, and what actually ships are two different things. Also, I wish Amazon would add a speaker mute button; you can mute the microphone, but if your phone rings or something else requires you to want Alexa to stop making noise, you have to tell her to be quiet or pause; a speaker mute button would be nice. I suppose you could use the (-) volume control to turn her all the way down, but a quick and easy mute button would be faster and easier! Love this unit -- just not what they call "red."

I have reset reset reset, deleted app, downloaded app, reset reset reset. This thing is about as stupid as my ex. Nice job Amazon. You make me want to go back to Apple which I swore I never would.

Title: Well worth upgrading
Body: I just upgraded from an Echo Dot to the latest Echo device, and overall I am quite pleased.  The sound quality is amazingly better for playing music from multiple sources, and interaction with Alexa is also very good.  The only quibble I have is that the new Echo does not seem to recognize my voice commands as easily as the Echo Dot when I am farther away from it; and there are a few commands that, somehow, the Echo does not understand (although the Echo Dot certainly did, and does).  Nonetheless, I am still very pleased I made the upgrade.

I will give them a pass because this is a new technology. I love the fact that I have a GROUP called Everywhere and I can stream music on this Echo and all three dots at the same time and it is clean and consistent through the entire house. This is very nice on days when I am cleaning the house and go from room to room, and during the holidays when I had everyone over. Overall I am satisfied, and I look for even more things from Amazon. Title: Alexa can be frustrating
Body: The sound is good, I sometimes wonder if I should have gotten the speaker with the sub, but good sound for what I did order. I spent three days trying to get Alexa to play "Deadmen" By Saint PHNX, a song I purchased. Even if I had not bought it she would not have played it. Kept wanting to play "Deadman Walking" by IDK and IDC. So if I had prime she would have queued that up every time. Finally, while almost placing my mouth on her, Alexa figured it out on the third day. But also it is in my only playlist, that I play, then it stops after like 10 songs. I do think Amazon is trying to gaslight me into buying prime for better use of my Echo.She does do well answering questions, turning on devices, playing what music I can get out of her though.

Title: Scary but so neat
Body: This was a Christmas gift.  I did not want it, left it boxed for a few days, and generally wondered about sending it back without offending the gifter.  Then I un-boxed it.  30 minutes later I ordered another Echo for upstairs, and since then purchased a Sonos Beam with Alexa soundbar for our TV.  It's like an entire new world to us.As perspective, we use Siri for dictation and questions, but had a scary incident when the "Hey Siri" feature was first activated by Apple.  We discovered she was listening to us when Siri started replying to what she heard on TV.  So that feature got turned off  fast on our iPhones and iPads.  The fact that we can switch off Alexa's microphone is of great comfort to us.  But more importantly, the many things Alexa can do that greatly expands our electronic footprint and comfort zone was worth the effort.  We are happy campers.  I just wish Alexa would stop asking if we want to order more pet treats...we're afraid our pup will bark while we're out and who knows what we'll end up with.

Title: The best time to upgrade old hardware. Now!
Body: I love this version of Alexa. I have the original echo as well. The biggest difference between this echo and the 1st gen is probably voice recognition, its can really pick up voices even while music and or audiobooks are playing. The next best improvement is probably sound quality, the bass of this echo is impressive. I haven't needed to push the volume past 6 for music and 4 for audiobooks. This is a very good gift for the right person. Or even yourself. Highly recommended.

Title: Fun, entertaining, and informative.
Body: I purchased it mainly for music since I don't have a stereo in my home other than a small boombox, which I don't use because it doesn't sound all that great. But I have to say that Echo sounds better audio quality than the portable radio. I have hearing loss due to an accident years ago, so I really shouldn't be rating sound quality, it is difficult for me to hear some tones. The Alexa app on my Android phone has a simple EQ. While it does help, it's not sensitive enough to compensate for my poor hearing.Even so, I can hear good enough to enjoy music on my Echo, which is linked in a special group with two Echo Dot devices in separate rooms. I can walk around the house and have music wherever I go. This is an awesome feature.I've learned to use it for weather and news reports as well as set reminders, timers, and lists. Plus I have some fun askingng Alexa to play Star Trek sounds and other cool stuff.I also set Alexa to "away" mode when I leave the house and she listens for common noises like glass breaking and will alert me if she hears anything suspicious. She's definitely not a security device. But it's nice to know she's got an ear for possible intruders and will let me know.A great feature is the relaxing music or pleasing sounds that I play when going to sleep. I especially like the ocean waves for sleeping.One issue I've experienced, Echo and Echo Dot become unresponsive once in a while. I have to unplug and reconnect power to reinitialize functionality. I'm not sure what's causing this problem? It could be my network/WiFi signal or some other problem technical problem so I can't ding Echo for the issue just yet. Luckily the issue is random and infrequent.I'm still discovering new features. I never thought I'd say this, but Alexa with Echo has enhanced the enjoyment of my home. In all, I love my Echo.

The Echo Studio would have better sound, but at twice the price of the Echo. We like the looks; much more attractive than the 1st gen. Voice recognition is better than the Dot also; maybe because there are more microphones. The fact that we got a Black Friday discount is icing on the cake. Very satisfied with this purchase.

Title: Extra location is most helpful.
Body: We were given an Alexa with a subsidiary Echo Dot for Christmas,  which we placed in the living room and kitchen. We like it so much that we purchased an additonal Echo Dot for the library upstairs. We haven't explored all the functions, but so far we've found it very helpful for music in different locations, as well as being able to add to the shopping list whenever an item occurs, rather than wait til we are able to write it down on a shopping list. An additional feature is that when someone is out grocery shopping, and the one at home suddenly remembers something which they'd forgotten was needed, they can add it to the list, and it appears on the shopper's phone. Very helpful!
